Package support

Class Console

java.lang.Object
support.Console
public class Console extends Object
A class that represents a console for interacting with the program. It handles user input, executes commands, and outputs messages to the console.

  • Constructor Details

    • Console

      public Console(Scanner scanner, CommandControl commandControl, FileControl fileControl, CollectionControl collectionControl)
      Constructs a new Console object.
      Parameters:
      scanner - a Scanner object to read user input from the console
      commandControl - a CommandControl object to access and execute commands
      fileControl - a FileControl object to read and write data to files
      collectionControl - a CollectionControl object to access and manipulate the collection of workers

  • Method Details

    • interactive

      public void interactive()
      Starts an interactive session with the user. Reads user input, executes commands, and outputs messages to the console.

    • chooseCommand

      public Command chooseCommand(String[] userCommand) throws InputException
      Searches for and returns the Command object corresponding to the user's input.
      Parameters:
      userCommand - an array containing the user's input, with the first element being the command name and the second element being its arguments
      Returns:
      the Command object corresponding to the user's input
      Throws:
      InputException - if the command specified by the user is not recognized

    • write

      public static void write(Object outPut)
      Outputs the specified object to the console, without adding a newline character.
      Parameters:
      outPut - the object to output to the console

    • writeln

      public static void writeln(Object outPut)
      Outputs the specified object to the console, followed by a newline character.
      Parameters:
      outPut - the object to output to the console

    • err

      public static void err(Object outPut)
      Outputs the specified object to the console as an error message, preceded by the string "Error: ".
      Parameters:
      outPut - the object to output to the console as an error message
